fabric.dissemination

Interface FetchManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DummyFetchManager, PastryFetchManager

    public interface FetchManager
    A FetchManager is responsible for retrieving objects from Stores via a dissemination layer. Workers may load different FetchManagers at run time to make use of different dissemination networks.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Called to destroy and clean up the fetch manager.
      ObjectGroup fetch(RemoteStore store, long onum)
      Fetches the glob identified by the given onum, located at the given store.
      boolean updateCaches(RemoteStore store, long onum, AbstractGlob<?> update)
      Updates the dissemination and worker caches with the given glob.

    • Method Detail

      • fetch

        ObjectGroup fetch(RemoteStore store,
                  long onum)
           throws AccessException
        Fetches the glob identified by the given onum, located at the given store.
        Parameters:
        store - the store.
        onum - the object identifier.
        Returns:
        the requested glob if fetch was successful.
        Throws:
        AccessException
        UnreachableNodeException

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Called to destroy and clean up the fetch manager.

      • updateCaches

        boolean updateCaches(RemoteStore store,
                     long onum,
                     AbstractGlob<?> update)
        Updates the dissemination and worker caches with the given glob.
        Returns:
        true iff there was a dissemination-cache entry for the given oid.
